item.title: Services for Students Pursuing Higher Studies in Taiwan
item.description: Services for Students Pursuing Higher Studies in Taiwan Are you considering pursuing your bachelor’s, master’s, or Ph.D. studies in Taiwan? We offer comprehensive services tailored to your needs and aimed at making your transition to Taiwanese universities seamless and efficient. STEP 1: Initial Consultation In this step, we provide you with valuable insights into the current conditions in Taiwan and assess your specific requirements. Through an audio/video call, we discuss your aspirations and concerns, offering personalized advice to kickstart your journey.

item.title: 7-Step Guide for International Students
item.description: Study in Taiwan: A 7-Step Guide for International Students Introduction Studying in Taiwan offers numerous opportunities for international students seeking quality education in a vibrant cultural environment. This guide presents a step-by-step approach to help prospective students navigate the application process effectively. Step 1: Eligibility Assessment Before proceeding with your application, ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria for international students as per the MOE Regulations Regarding International Students Undertaking Studies in Taiwan.

item.title: Eligibility Requirements for International Students Applying to Taiwanese Universities
item.description: Eligibility Requirements for International Students Introduction When applying for admission to universities in Taiwan as an international student, it’s crucial to understand the eligibility requirements and application procedures. This guide provides comprehensive information to help prospective students navigate the process. Requirements Overview There are various pathways to apply for admission, depending on the desired subject of study and the applicant’s background. It’s important to note that requirements and deadlines may differ between universities and degree programs.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: Q1: Am I eligible to apply as an international student? You will be eligible as an international student if you fulfill the following 3 conditions: You have foreign nationality and have never studied in Taiwan before as an overseas Chinese student at the time of application. You have never been admitted through admission placement by the University Entrance Committee for Overseas Chinese Student at the time of application. You must apply in accordance with the “Regulations Regarding International Students Undertaking Studies in Taiwan” by the Ministry of Education (MOE).

item.title: Higher Education System in Taiwan
item.description: Higher Education System Taiwan boasts an excellent global competitiveness despite limited natural resources. According to the World Competitiveness Yearbook 2019 published by the International Institute for Management Development (IMD) in Switzerland, Taiwan ranked 16th overall in global competitiveness among 63 countries, excelling in “Economic Performance” and “Business Efficiency Indices.” This economic prowess is attributed to Taiwan’s high-quality human resources, which are closely linked to the quality of its higher education system.

item.title: Quick Facts About Taiwan
item.description: Where is Taiwan? Taiwan and its surrounding islands are situated in East Asia at the northwestern edge of the Pacific Ocean. It possesses an endless variety of terrains, forests, agricultural products, and marine ecologies, as well as a diversity of ethnic cultures along with enchanting human customs and practices. Location: Taiwan is located off the eastern and southeastern coasts of the Asian continent, between Japan and the Philippines. It measures approximately 400 kilometers from north to south and around 145 kilometers from east to west at its widest.
